definition: to pull strongly against a crazy tide (idiom); fig. to try hard to save a desperate crisis
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
surname Li
to pull/to draw (a cart or a bow)/to roll up/to coil/to carry on the arm/to lament the dead/(fig.) to pull against/to recover
mad/wild/violent
swelling water

sentences.english: Who can now tell them apart?
The miracle, likes a star candy, which turns the tide.
sentences.chinese: 就像臭蛋中的星星糖一樣，她是能夠力挽狂瀾的奇蹟。

sentences.english: So how could Democrats salvage things?
sentences.chinese: 那麼民主黨將如何力挽狂瀾呢？

sentences.english: QiaoJinFan help company tide, the directors look favourably upon him.
sentences.chinese: 喬津帆幫公司力挽狂瀾，董事們對他另眼相看。

sentences.english: Even with this team, I managed to win.
sentences.chinese: 儘管隊友如此，我還是力挽狂瀾。

sentences.english: In both games they had a giant in the goal who saved everything and performed like the best keeper in the world.
sentences.chinese: 雙方都有能力挽狂瀾的高手，有世界上最好的門將。

definition: lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to turn a blind eye to
to spare no effort
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
to stick onto/stalemate/gridlock/to agglutinate
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
arrogance/haughtiness
already too late
